Positive pathway.Check-in message: Hi! Were you able to give your child or teen instructions? (Yes/No)
Positive pathway.Positive follow on question: Well done for trying, how did it go? (Great/Neutral/Bad)
Positive pathway.Great response message: Great to hear it went well, you are a star!

Challenge pathway (Neutral/Bad or No).Neutral/Bad or negative response message: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying!

Option 1: My child or teen did not want.Message: We know, our children need time to learn to follow instructions. Be patient, try again, and remember to praise them every time they follow an instruction!

Option 2: I gave a negative instead of a.Message: We know, it takes some time to get used to giving positive instructions – it’s really worth trying again! Think about behaviour you would love to see your teen do more, and think of positive ways to give that instruction!

Option 3: I gave too many instructions a.Message: We know, it is hard to remember to give one instruction at a time. When we do it, our child is more likely to listen – so we can praise them even more!

Option 4: My child or teen could not do.Message: It is hard to remember to give realistic instructions. Try to make sure that your child or teen can physically do what you want them to do. Be specific!

Option 5: I forgot to praise my child or.Message: Sometimes we just expect our children to do what we want them. But when we praise them for it, they feel encouraged to listen again next time!
